page.title: 14EDUCATION
page.content: Stanhoe's own school was closed in 1979 and the building sold as a private house. Since then the infant and primary children have been taken by mini-bus to Burnham Market. At present there are 12 children. Although the Burnham school has a playgroup on the premises it has not proved possible to provide transport from Stanhoe for the under 5's. Some parents with cars do, however, take their children to it. At 11 years all the pupils move to the Alderman Peel High School at Wells where there are 9 from Stanhoe this year. At 16 they can move to the Sixth Form Centre at Fakenham. For both of these a bus is provided. The Norfolk College for Arts and Technology also attracts some teenagers but students have to arrange their own transport.
